commit_message:
Enable Equallogic Backends in Cinder

Enables support for configuring Cinder with a Dell
Equallogic storage backend.
This change adds all relevant parameters for:
 - Equallogic PS-Series (iSCSI)

Change-Id: Ia0f71863cfb12f2cdda43dcf707a9a7145963001
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/40/242640/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hiera('cinder_enable_eqlx_backend', false) { $cinder_eqlx_backend = hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::volume_backend_name') cinder_config { "${cinder_eqlx_backend}/host": value => 'hostgroup'; } cinder::backend::eqlx { $cinder_eqlx_backend : volume_backend_name => hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::volume_backend_name', undef), san_ip => hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::san_ip', undef), san_login => hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::san_login', undef), san_password => hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::san_password', undef), san_thin_provision => hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::san_thin_provision', undef), eqlx_group_name => hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::eqlx_group_name', undef), eqlx_pool => hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::eqlx_lpool', undef), eqlx_use_chap => hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::eqlx_use_chap', undef), eqlx_chap_login => hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::eqlx_chap_login', undef), eqlx_chap_password => hiera('cinder::backend::eqlx::eqlx_san_password', undef), } } $cinder_enabled_backends = delete_undef_values([$cinder_iscsi_backend, $cinder_rbd_backend, $cinder_netapp_backend, $cinder_nfs_backend,$cinder_eqlx_backend])

commit_message:
Add Get Instances Rest API

Implements: blueprint instance-details-redesign
Change-Id: Iab44bc63ea3979a1e74cadd6da21899f411a4505
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/10/257610/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @urls.register class Instances(generic.View): """API for nova instances. """ url_regex = r'nova/instances/$' @rest_utils.ajax() def get(self, request): """Get a list of instances. The listing result is an object with property "items". Each item is an instance. By default this will return the flavors instance for the user's current project. :param is_public: set to True to see all public instances Example GET: http://localhost/api/nova/instances/?is_public=true """ is_public = request.GET.get('is_public') == 'true' result = api.nova.server_list(request, None, is_public) return {'items': [api.nova.Server(i, request).to_dict() for i in result]}

subject: Wrong usage of "a/an"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-30 00:19:38.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/contrib/auth/v3/saml2.py', 'keystoneclient/v3/regions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/bc85765e474bb40534dadb4eba76689650a468b7', 'message': 'Wrong usage of "a/an"

Wrong usage of "a/an" in the messages:
"string that is the id field for an pre-existing"
"build a etree.XML object filling certain"

Should be:
"string that is the id field for a pre-existing"
"build an etree.XML object filling certain"

Totally 2 occurrences in python-keystoneclient base code.

Change-Id: Icef5247672f95af87375a4a135a961aefb0a4906
'}]
commit_message:
Wrong usage of "a/an"

Wrong usage of "a/an" in the messages:
"string that is the id field for an pre-existing"
"build a etree.XML object filling certain"

Should be:
"string that is the id field for a pre-existing"
"build an etree.XML object filling certain"

Totally 2 occurrences in python-keystoneclient base code.

Change-Id: Icef5247672f95af87375a4a135a961aefb0a4906
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/40/262340/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * parent_region_id: string that is the id field for a pre-existing
deleted_lines: * parent_region_id: string that is the id field for an pre-existing

commit_message:
Use ironic-lib's util methods

ironic.common.utils.dd(), mkfs(), unlink_without_raise(),
and is_http_url() methods were moved to ironic-lib. This
removes the copies in ironic and updates the code to use
the methods in ironic-lib.

Change-Id: I09c0a037b7979079cbfe5e33cbfd157ea3f3f79d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/65/260865/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Docs] Remove _build directory before main cmd

`tox -edocs` doesn't work as expected if ./docs/source/_build dir exists.

Change-Id: Ibe37590e0c9cbb1de06a488407bb9596120d87e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/06/262606/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: whitelist_externals = find rm make find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -deletecommands = rm -rf _build make html

commit_message:
Ensure link is set to up, when moving IP addresses across interfaces.

 - To add, initialize and set up a valiable named IP_UP
 - To bring up interface after moving IP to OVS bridge

Change-Id: I70f5974c115be6f7e7422a9a325f36cf3b71455a
Closes-Bug: #1469596
(cherry picked from commit f95315b6ea56b3f2cb18caeac734dd15e6704b93)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/65/263065/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local IP_UP="" local DEFAULT_ROUTE_GW DEFAULT_ROUTE_GW=$(ip r | awk "/default.+$from_intf/ { print \$3; exit }") IP_UP="sudo ip link set $to_intf up" $IP_DEL; $IP_ADD; $IP_UP; $ADD_OVS_PORT; $ADD_DEFAULT_ROUTE
deleted_lines: local DEFAULT_ROUTE_GW=$(ip r | awk "/default.+$from_intf/ { print \$3; exit }") $IP_DEL; $IP_ADD; $ADD_OVS_PORT; $ADD_DEFAULT_ROUTE

commit_message:
[Docs] Fix metavars

 - added custom metavars
 - added generator for metavars

Before this patch:
$ rally task start --help
...
optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --deployment ACTION_KWARG_DEPLOYMENT
                        UUID or name of the deployment
  --task ACTION_KWARG_TASK, --filename ACTION_KWARG_TASK
                        Path to the input task file
  --task-args ACTION_KWARG_TASK_ARGS
                        Input task args (dict in json). These args are used to
                        render input task that is jinja2 template.
  --task-args-file ACTION_KWARG_TASK_ARGS_FILE
                        Path to the file with input task args (dict in
                        json/yaml). These args are used to render input task
                        that is jinja2 template.
  --tag ACTION_KWARG_TAG
                        Tag for this task
  --no-use              Don't set new task as default for future operations
  --abort-on-sla-failure
                        Abort the execution of a benchmark scenario whenany
                        SLA check for it fails

After:
$ rally task start --help
...
optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --deployment <uuid>
                        UUID or name of the deployment
  --task <path>, --filename <path>
                        Path to the input task file
  --task-args <json>
                        Input task args (dict in json). These args are used to
                        render input task that is jinja2 template.
  --task-args-file <path>
                        Path to the file with input task args (dict in
                        json/yaml). These args are used to render input task
                        that is jinja2 template.
  --tag <tag>           Tag for this task
  --no-use              Don't set new task as default for future operations
  --abort-on-sla-failure
                        Abort the execution of a benchmark scenario whenany
                        SLA check for it fails

Change-Id: I7a059eb151aecf219496a43f8427b64c0265b3ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/63/262763/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @cliutils.args("--task", "--filename", metavar="<path>", help="Path to the input task file")
deleted_lines: @cliutils.args("--task", "--filename", help="Path to the input task file")

subject: Add Fujitsu ETERNUS DX Volume Driver (again)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-14 10:59:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3ba28b0578d5144c49313121750be7a38160f380', 'message': 'Add Fujitsu ETERNUS DX Volume Driver (again)

This driver supports FUJITSU Storage ETERNUS DX.
The volume driver for ETERNUS DX dropped at Kilo,
because we could not prepare 3rd party CI until deadline (Kilo-3),
I upload it again.We planned re-merging of our driver for Liberty.

[Supported Protocol]
 - FC
 - iSCSI

[Supported Feature]
 - Volume Create/Delete
 - Volume Attach/Detach
 - Snapshot Create/Delete
 - Create Volume from Snapshot
 - Get Volume Stats
 - Copy Image to Volume,
 - Copy Volume to Image
 - Clone Volume
 - Extend Volume

Change-Id: Iea6ed679616ccf4bd7aa0c5f6ad6067aa1bed7f6
Implements: blueprint fujitsu-eternus-dx-driver

commit_message:
Add Fujitsu ETERNUS DX Volume Driver (again)

This driver supports FUJITSU Storage ETERNUS DX.
The volume driver for ETERNUS DX dropped at Kilo,
because we could not prepare 3rd party CI until deadline (Kilo-3).
I upload it again for Mitaka release.

[Supported Protocol]
 - iSCSI

[Supported Feature]
 - Volume Create/Delete
 - Volume Attach/Detach
 - Snapshot Create/Delete
 - Create Volume from Snapshot
 - Get Volume Stats
 - Copy Image to Volume,
 - Copy Volume to Image
 - Clone Volume
 - Extend Volume

DocImpact
Change-Id: Iea6ed679616ccf4bd7aa0c5f6ad6067aa1bed7f6
Implements: blueprint fujitsu-eternus-dx-driver

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 FUJITSU LIMITED # Copyright (c) 2012 EMC Corporation. # Copyright (c) 2012 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # ''' FibreChannel Cinder Volume driver for Fujitsu ETERNUS DX S3 series. ''' import six from cinder.i18n import _LI from cinder.volume import driver from cinder.volume.drivers.fujitsu import eternus_dx_common from cinder.zonemanager import utils as fczm_utils from oslo_concurrency import lockutils from oslo_log import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class FJDXFCDriver(driver.FibreChannelDriver): ''' ETERNUS FC Cinder Volume Driver for Fujitsu ETERNUS DX S3 series ''' def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): ''' Constructor ''' super(FJDXFCDriver, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.common = eternus_dx_common.FJDXCommon( 'fc', configuration=self.configuration) self.VERSION = self.common.VERSION return def check_for_setup_error(self): return @lockutils.synchronized('ETERNUS_DX-vol', 'cinder-', True) def create_volume(self, volume): ''' Create volume ''' LOG.info(_LI('create_volume,Enter method')) metadata = None v_metadata = None data = None (location, metadata) = self.common.create_volume(volume) v_metadata = volume.get('volume_metadata') for data in v_metadata: metadata[data['key']] = data['value'] LOG.info(_LI('create_volume,Exit method')) return {'provider_location': six.text_type(location), 'metadata': metadata} @lockutils.synchronized('ETERNUS_DX-vol', 'cinder-', True) def create_volume_from_snapshot(self, volume, snapshot): ''' Creates a volume from a snapshot. ''' LOG.info(_LI('creaet_volume_from_snapshot,Enter method')) metadata = None v_metadata = None data = None (location, metadata) =\ self.common.create_volume_from_snapshot(volume, snapshot) v_metadata = volume.get('volume_metadata') for data in v_metadata: metadata[data['key']] = data['value'] LOG.info(_LI('creaet_volume_from_snapshot,Exit method')) return {'provider_location': six.text_type(location), 'metadata': metadata} @lockutils.synchronized('ETERNUS_DX-vol', 'cinder-', True) def create_cloned_volume(self, volume, src_vref): """Create cloned volume.""" LOG.info(_LI('creaet_cloned_volume,Enter method')) metadata = None v_metadata = None data = None (location, metadata) =\ self.common.create_cloned_volume(volume, src_vref) v_metadata = volume.get('volume_metadata') for data in v_metadata: metadata[data['key']] = data['value'] LOG.info(_LI('creaet_cloned_volume,Exit method')) return {'provider_location': six.text_type(location), 'metadata': metadata} @lockutils.synchronized('ETERNUS_DX-vol', 'cinder-', True) def delete_volume(self, volume): ''' Delete volume on ETERNUS. ''' LOG.info(_LI('delete_volume,Enter method')) self.common.delete_volume(volume) LOG.info(_LI('delete_volume,Exit method')) return @lockutils.synchronized('ETERNUS_DX-vol', 'cinder-', True) def create_snapshot(self, snapshot): ''' Creates a snapshot. ''' LOG.info(_LI('create_snapshot,Enter method')) location = self.common.create_snapshot(snapshot) LOG.info(_LI('create_snapshot,Exit method')) return {'provider_location': six.text_type(location)} @lockutils.synchronized('ETERNUS_DX-vol', 'cinder-', True) def delete_snapshot(self, snapshot): ''' Deletes a snapshot. ''' LOG.info(_LI('delete_snapshot,Enter method')) self.common.delete_snapshot(snapshot) LOG.info(_LI('delete_snapshot,Exit method')) return def ensure_export(self, context, volume): """Synchronously recreates an export for a volume.""" return def create_export(self, context, volume): """Exports the volume.""" return def remove_export(self, context, volume): """Removes an export for a volume.""" return @fczm_utils.AddFCZone @lockutils.synchronized('ETERNUS_DX-vol', 'cinder-', True) def initialize_connection(self, volume, connector): ''' Allow connection to connector and return connection info. ''' LOG.info(_LI('initialize_connection,Enter method')) info = self.common.initialize_connection(volume, connector) LOG.info(_LI('initialize_connection,' 'connection info: %(info)s' 'Exit method') % {'info': info}) return info @fczm_utils.RemoveFCZone @lockutils.synchronized('ETERNUS_DX-vol', 'cinder-', True) def terminate_connection(self, volume, connector, **kwargs): ''' Disallow connection from connector. ''' LOG.info(_LI('terminate_connection,Enter method')) self.common.terminate_connection(volume, connector) LOG.info(_LI('terminate_connection,Exit method')) return @lockutils.synchronized('ETERNUS_DX-vol', 'cinder-', True) def get_volume_stats(self, refresh=False): ''' Get volume stats. If 'refresh' is True, run update the stats first. ''' LOG.debug('get_volume_stats,Enter method') if refresh: data = self.common.update_volume_stats() backend_name = self.configuration.safe_get('volume_backend_name') data['volume_backend_name'] = backend_name or 'FJDXFCDriver' data['storage_protocol'] = 'fibre_channel' self._stats = data # end of if LOG.debug('get_volume_stats,Exit method') return self._stats @lockutils.synchronized('ETERNUS_DX-vol', 'cinder-', True) def extend_volume(self, volume, new_size): ''' Extend volume. ''' LOG.info(_LI('extend_volume,Enter method')) self.common.extend_volume(volume, new_size) LOG.info(_LI('extend_volume,Exit method')) return

commit_message:
Use run_as_root instead of sudo to execute_command

* use run_as_root=True instead of 'sudo' when calling execute_command
* format multi-line string value of init_db_template

Closes-Bug: #1530284
Change-Id: I8a3b6a069693abf0b3b726c9e221c378f350e19d

commit_message:
Do not log secrets

When logging the curl command or the http response we should obfuscate
the secrets.

Change-Id: Iaf8aef795782b5c4608f3a2be6887d0429176250
Partial-Bug: 1530972

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from ironicclient.common import http from ironicclient.tests.unit import utils class HTTPClientTestCase(utils.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(HTTPClientTestCase, self).setUp() self.client = http.HTTPClient('http://127.0.0.1:1234/v1') @mock.patch.object(http.LOG, 'debug', autospec=True) def test_log_curl_request_mask_password(self, mock_log): kwargs = {'headers': {'foo-header': 'bar-header'}, 'body': '{"password": "foo"}'} self.client.log_curl_request('foo', 'http://127.0.0.1', kwargs) expected_log = ("curl -i -X foo -H 'foo-header: bar-header' " "-d '{"password": "***"}' http://127.0.0.1") mock_log.assert_called_once_with(expected_log) @mock.patch.object(http.LOG, 'debug', autospec=True) def test_log_http_response_mask_password(self, mock_log): fake_response = utils.FakeResponse({}, version=1, reason='foo', status=200) body = '{"password": "foo"}' self.client.log_http_response(fake_response, body=body) expected_log = ("

") mock_log.assert_called_once_with(expected_log)

commit_message:
taskmanager: require package before config file

Before trying to build the guestagent config file from the template with
Puppet, first install the package so we make sure /etc/trove is ready.

Otherwise, Puppet will randomly fail to create the file, if the package
is not installed yet.

Change-Id: I65518d53d98aa114f8e5803910b3266d9b68e491
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-trove refs/changes/79/263079/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change L3 agent delete HA-router Sequence

This patch will change the sequence of events in delete ha-router.
First ha router namespace is deleted then keepalived is disabled
which ends up in keepalive running out of control.

this change happened accidently in patch [1]

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/217564/7

Change-Id: I6e266f30409cdd6669bff3effca1f55d8de68207
Closes-Bug: #1510759

commit_message:
Be consistent in how we give error codes in the Identity spec

Throughout the spec, we use various ways of given the HTTP error
codes, sometimes quoted, sometimes not, sometimes with the "HTTP"
moniker, sometimes not.

This patch makes this consistent, using the form:

HTTP ``400 Bad Request``

No actual changes to the error code being returned are being
made, this is just about formatting the document.

Change-Id: Icc21ebd1262ae889c7dcc4ee43ad203d52bcab0d

commit_message:
Use configured datastore on instance creation

The datastore and its version is now always passed on instance creation for
integration tests.
Previously the default datastore (and version) were used, ignoring the
settings in the test configuration.

Change-Id: Ib3e78bb68aaf992177b9d9cd1d89e84fb54830ed
Depends-On: Ifa4496eb1c9e2fe053978c708e7fa1069f12cb3f

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox and remove py33

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run
py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this
problem to happen.

Change-Id: I135cbbfcfb148ba845af43634d41951e118067f9
Closes-bug: #1489059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/xstatic-rickshaw refs/changes/46/260546/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py33,py34,py27

commit_message:
In port_dead, handle case when port already deleted

db_get_val can return None if the port got deleted concurrently.
In this case there is no need to mark it dead and add drop flow for it.

Change-Id: I5ef9665770df3a9bbaf79049b219fadd73e20309
Partial-Bug: #1493414
(cherry picked from commit 76cc53c611a639d915761d1fa3c879cda2ba3502)

commit_message:
Add keylistener to navigate tests on timeline

Adds an arrow key listener (for left and right arrows) on the timeline.
Once a test is selected, the arrow keys can be used to select adjacent
tests on the same worker thread. This helps select tests with small
run times that may be difficult to select using only the mouse.

Change-Id: Ia1691ef9e85d1f8e54e37ea8cbcd3834fe5064fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/stackviz refs/changes/86/252586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: //navigate from current worker rectangle using arrow keys. // TODO: handle typeError when next/prev rect is out of range d3.select(window) .on('keydown', function(i) { if (selectedRect) { var self = d3.select(selectedRect); var code = d3.event.keyCode; //left arrow if (code == 37) { //yes, it really is a quadruply nested array. self = d3.select(self[0][0][0][0].previousElementSibling); } //right arrow if (code == 39) { //yes, it really is a quadruply nested array. self = d3.select(self[0][0][0][0].nextElementSibling); } try { selectItem(self, self.datum()); } catch (er) {} scope.$apply(); } });

remove suport for py33

Python 3.3 is not supported from Mitaka, as per
Infra, therefore removing the support for the same.

Change-Id: I27436e05e373c6a5d1d71ff60cd15e0db05e87df
Closes-Bug: #1526170

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run
py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this
problem to happen.

Change-Id: I461e4f0d931a9bbc37670dc2cd70d94f86acfb24
Closes-bug: #1489059

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-17 01:20:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum-ui/commit/c99a585a4877581df2ad4da2f4841902307b7fab', 'message': 'Use Horizon's plugin regstration system

Magnum UI and their panels are currently registered via their `dashboard.py`
and `panel.py` files, but should use the enabled files.
This is standard in Horizon.

This patch changes regstration method to enabled files.

For moving our dashboard to under the "project" dashbaord,
we need to change URLs, slugs of panels and Angular module names.
So, many files will be changed.

commit_message:
Use Horizon's plugin registration system

Magnum UI and their panels are currently registered via their `dashboard.py`
and `panel.py` files, but should use the enabled files.
This is standard in Horizon.

This patch changes registration method to enabled files.

For moving our dashboard to under the "project" dashbaord,
we need to change URLs. So, many files will be changed.

Since "/project/containers" is already used by Swift Container panel,
this patch uses "bays", "baymodels" and "bays/containers" for URLs.

Change-Id: Icedb984331bd46540f2e7d12bbefcc308aff214f
Closes-Bug: #1507679
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum-ui refs/changes/58/256358/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix reclaim_instance_interval < 0 never delete instance completely

CONF.reclaim_instance_interval is interval in seconds for reclaiming
deleted instances. It should take effect only when value is greater
than 0. But current when set it with -1 for example, it will pass check
if we should soft delete an instance, but can't pass check whether should
clean soft deleted instance, then never have chance to clean up a soft deleted
instance and release the quota.
This commit sets CONF.reclaim_instance_interval's minimum value to 0.

Closes-Bug: #1518848

Change-Id: Idd8faad1a40f8898a9471504e664c3676b1b0e06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/248539/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if CONF.reclaim_instance_interval > 0:

commit_message:
Add python-monascaclient to requirements

* Closes-Bug: #1530007

  Rally project has gate-rally-requirements job. Currently, the
  job fails due to "incompatible reqirement found" and this
  issue blocks patch to add monasca test to Rally

Change-Id: I2b12b00cf47d521c22e44bd412c02417817e3ea1

commit_message:
Scality SOFS: don't always read /proc/mounts twice

If the Scale Out FS is correcty mounted and found in /proc/mounts
then there's no need to read /proc/mounts again.

Change-Id: I8fa33cc80d2491d98986053f678cdf7983132bf9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/15/250915/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check whether the mount command succeeded if not self._sofs_is_mounted(): msg = _("Cannot mount Scality SOFS, check syslog for errors") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg)
deleted_lines: if not self._sofs_is_mounted(): msg = _("Cannot mount Scality SOFS, check syslog for errors") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg)

subject: Refactor the timeline directive.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-24 00:36:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/stackviz/commit/40b6c48255dfe050f798bf1e00dce9349236669c', 'message': 'Refactor the timeline directive.

Presently the timeline directive is a single gigantic directive
containing all of the timeline code. Given the amount of code
involved, this complicates maintenance and makes it excessively
difficult to improve.

This refactors the single timeline directive into four separate
collaborating directives: a controller, an overview, a viewport,
and dstat charts. Each child directive is functionally separate
from the others, but can communicate with other chart components
via the controller. This separation should greatly improve future
maintenance, and has already led to several (included) bug fixes.

Change-Id: Id11d15a34466e42c5ebc9808717d52b468245e3a

via the controller. This separation should greatly improve future
maintenance, and has already led to several (included) bug fixes.

Change-Id: Id11d15a34466e42c5ebc9808717d52b468245e3a

commit_message:
Refactor the timeline directive.

Presently the timeline directive is a single gigantic directive
containing all of the timeline code. Given the amount of code
involved, this complicates maintenance and makes it excessively
difficult to improve.

This refactors the single timeline directive into four separate
collaborating directives: a controller, an overview, a viewport,
and dstat charts. Each child directive is functionally separate
from the others, but can communicate with other chart components
via the controller. This separation should greatly improve future
maintenance, and has already led to several (included) bug fixes.

Change-Id: Id11d15a34466e42c5ebc9808717d52b468245e3a

commit_message:
Remove boto deprecation warnings in the unit tests

The following boto warning appears a couple of times in the unit test
logs.

    PendingDeprecationWarning: The current get_all_instances
implementation will be replaced with get_all_reservations.

Remove the warnings by replacing get_all_instances with
get_all_reservations, as the boto docs suggest. Also note that
get_all_instances just calls get_all_reservations at the moment anyway.

    "This method's current behavior is deprecated in favor of
get_all_reservations. A future major release will change
get_all_instances to return a list of Instance objects as its name
suggests."

https://github.com/boto/boto/blob/8a025df86554a555cb4b58357803f4df044e2c6f/boto/ec2/connection.py#L580

Change-Id: I2a3f6d4c2a3ce9944dc0cb30377e23c62a68fe40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/263524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support DB clustering configuration

You can specify ['ip1:port', 'ip2:port', 'ip3:port'] list in the
configuration file.

If only one server exists, just set it to ['ip:port'].

This option is the same to rabbitmq configuration.

In addition, the whole oslo.cfg object is passed to db driver layer
in order to let developers decide which option to use.

Change-Id: I44fcf0af5a7740af720557bc7a0c60fcf389a416
Implements: bp zookeeper-driver
Closes-Bug: #1529325

commit_message:
Definitely disable dhcp-agent

DF does not use the dhcp agent, but devstack enables dhcp agent by
default, so this patch definitely disable dhcp agent.

Change-Id: Ib2dff6b6ba05e0f7facdedc4aa189f73a4fbfdf2

Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated. It still used in a few places.
Updated to non-deprecated LOG.warning.

subject: Dont log warnings for image cache when disabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-05 01:31:59.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/flows/manager/create_volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/382b56f2fe86659a26b3cdeb20f804245fb6ba6e', 'message': 'Dont log warnings for image cache when disabled

Right now we do a check for the internal tenant and log a warning before
we check to see if the cache is even turned on for that backend. We
should be only checking for the internal tenant if the image cache has
been configured for the backend.

In addition we shouldnt log a warning for this since there is already
a warning for the internal context when we try and create it if it is
not configured correctly to reduce the warning spam this change
switches the log message to an info level.

Change-Id: Iddc4648543d268a4b3b8d557c94c4d2876654e22
Closes-Bug: #1530964
'}]
commit_message:
Dont log warnings for image cache when disabled

Right now we do a check for the internal tenant and log a warning before
we check to see if the cache is even turned on for that backend. We
should be only checking for the internal tenant if the image cache has
been configured for the backend.

In addition we shouldnt log a warning for this since there is already
a warning for the internal context when we try and create it if it is
not configured correctly to reduce the warning spam this change
switches the log message to an info level.

Change-Id: Iddc4648543d268a4b3b8d557c94c4d2876654e22
Closes-Bug: #1530964

of weights.BaseHostWeigher.

commit_message:
VMware: add in folder support on VC

In an effort to provide more information to VC admins we create a
a folder that will contain the OpenStack information. VM's will be
put in the following folder:
    Openstack/Project (<project-id>)/Instances

Until this patch the VM's were put in the root folder.

NOTE: the code is backward compatible. All newly created instances
will be placed in the aforementioned folder. Existing instances will
continue to work as usual.

This is the first part of the blueprint vmware-better-display-names

Change-Id: I6c653cf580e844f121a6566c4f2cbe320531f4e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/165060/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_vmware import vim_util as vutil# A simple cache for storing inventory folder references. # Format: {inventory_path: folder_ref} _FOLDER_PATH_REF_MAPPING = {} # Format: {folder_ref.value: inventory_path} _FOLDER_REF_PATH_MAPPING = {} def _get_entity_name(session, entity): return session._call_method(vutil, 'get_object_property', entity, 'name') def _get_folder(session, parent_folder_ref, name): # Get list of child entities for the parent folder prop_val = session._call_method(vutil, 'get_object_property', parent_folder_ref, 'childEntity') if prop_val: child_entities = prop_val.ManagedObjectReference # Return if the child folder with input name is already present for child_entity in child_entities: if child_entity._type != 'Folder': continue child_entity_name = _get_entity_name(session, child_entity) if child_entity_name == name: return child_entity def create_folder(session, parent_folder_ref, name): LOG.debug("Creating folder '%s'", name) folder = _get_folder(session, parent_folder_ref, name) if folder: LOG.debug("Folder already exists: %s.", name) return folder LOG.debug("Creating folder: %s.", name) try: folder = session._call_method(session.vim, "CreateFolder", parent_folder_ref, name=name) except vexc.DuplicateName as e: val = e.details['object'] folder = vim_util.get_moref(val, 'Folder') LOG.info(_LI("Created folder: %s."), name) return folder def folder_ref_cache_update(path, folder_ref): _FOLDER_PATH_REF_MAPPING[path] = folder_ref _FOLDER_REF_PATH_MAPPING[folder_ref.value] = path def folder_ref_cache_get(path): return _FOLDER_PATH_REF_MAPPING.get(path)

commit_message:
Move oslo.policy from oslo to keystone

Changes to oslo.policy will be handled by keystone core rather
than oslo.

Change-Id: I05262e966c6297dd192a17f145376bbfd2557572

commit_message:
Clarify project hierarchy and parent usage within the API

The current description was not clear in a few areas:

- The fact that you can use parent_id on create to imply which
  domain the entity is in
- How entities created via the domain API compare with those
  projects acting as domains created via the project API
- How root domains are handled
- The fact that all projects are now part of a hierarchy

This patch clarifies the above and restructures the relevent
sections to make them more readible given the changes.

Change-Id: Ib9390cd71f111ed6e3131013d4a956db57d1d5ec
Partially-Implements: bp reseller
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/24/200624/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Starting with version 3.5, projects may, as well as holding OpenStack resources, also act as a domain (by setting the attribute ``is_domain`` to **true**), in which case it provides a namespace in which users, groups and other projects can be created. In fact, a domain created using the ``POST /domains`` API will actually be represented as a project with ``is_domain`` set to **true** with no parent. Projects that are acting as a domain created via the POST /projects API may have parents, and hence can be part of a hierarchy, although any parent of a project acting as a domain must be another project acting as a domain. Given this, all projects (except those acting as a domain that have no parent) are considered part of a project hierarchy. Projects created in a domain prior to version 3.5 are represented as a two-level hierarchy, with a project acting as a domain as the root and all other projects referencing the root as their parent. - ``is_domain`` (boolean) *New in version 3.5* Represents if the project has the domain feature. If this flag is set to ``true``, the project also acts as a domain, providing a name space in which users, groups and other projects can be created. If the flag is set to ``false``, then this is a regular project, which can only contain resources. If not provided, ``is_domain`` defaults to ``false``. This flag is immutable - can't be updated after the project is created. References the parent project. If specified, this places the project within a hierarchy and implicitly defines the owning domain, which will be the closest ancestor in the hierarchy to be acting as a domain. If a parent project is not specified and ``is_domain`` is ``false``, then the project will use its owning domain as its parent. If a parent project is not specified and ``is_domain`` is ``true``, then the project is acting as a top level domain with no parents. - ``domain_id`` (string) References the domain which owns the project; if neither a domain or a parent is not specified by the client, the Identity service implementation will default the domain to that which the client's token is scoped.Starting with version 3.5, domains created using the ``POST /domains`` API will actually be represented as a project with ``is_domain`` set to **true** with no parent. Projects acting as domains that do have parents cannot be accessed via the Domain API and can only be accessed via the Project API.
deleted_lines: - ``domain_id`` (string) References the domain which owns the project; if a domain is not specified by the client, the Identity service implementation will default it to the domain to which the client's token is scoped. References the parent project; if a parent project is not specified by the client, the Identity service will consider the project to be a top-level project (without any parents). All projects within a hierarchy must be owned by the same domain.- ``is_domain`` (boolean) *New in version 3.5* Represents if the project has the domain feature. If this flag is set to **true**, the project also acts as a domain, providing a name space in which users, groups and other projects can be created. If the flag is set to **false**, then this is a regular project, which can only contain resources. If not provided, ``is_domain`` defaults to **false**. This flag is immutable - can't be updated after the project is created.

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import pprint from oslo_versionedobjects import base as obj_base from oslo_versionedobjects import fixture from neutron.tests import base as test_base # NOTE: The hashes in this list should only be changed if they come with a # corresponding version bump in the affected objects. object_data = { 'QosBandwidthLimitRule': '1.0-4e44a8f5c2895ab1278399f87b40a13d', 'QosRuleType': '1.0-d0df298d49eeffab91af18d1a4cf7eaf', 'QosPolicy': '1.0-721fa60ea8f0e8f15d456d6e917dfe59', } class TestObjectVersions(test_base.BaseTestCase): def test_versions(self): checker = fixture.ObjectVersionChecker( obj_base.VersionedObjectRegistry.obj_classes()) fingerprints = checker.get_hashes() if os.getenv('GENERATE_HASHES'): file('object_hashes.txt', 'w').write( pprint.pformat(fingerprints)) expected, actual = checker.test_hashes(object_data) self.assertEqual(expected, actual, 'Some objects have changed; please make sure the ' 'versions have been bumped, and then update their ' 'hashes in the object_data map in this test module.')

commit_message:
Optimize simulator.py for better throughput

* Avoid string concatenation during logging, especially
  when logging level is disabled.
* Initialize the Randomized strings we will be using
  as payloads *before* we start sending the messages
  as the string creation takes time and reduces
  throughput

Change-Id: I546229fe7ade95572e11bcda95a587228d84bc28

commit_message:
Organize ZFSSA iscsi and nfs driver config-ref

block-storage/drivers/zfssa-{iscsi,nfs}-driver.rst have similiar
content, but different organizations. This patch organizes
these files to follow (roughly) the following:

-Supported operations
-Configuration
-ZFSSA additional feature info
-Extra specs/Driver options

Change-Id: I81c79cb95eb002bee9be31260263ece18b67711b
Closes-Bug: #1523151

commit_message:
rest: fix revision creation

Currently, there's a still an edge case if a user change both metrics and
something else in a PATCH request: no resource will be created at all because
'metrics' is found.

This fixes that.

Change-Id: Ic17a798ecba4892a07517a08bde4b2d96a1f3967
Related-Bug: #1520324

commit_message:
Live migration OSTF test failed with compute service unavailable

Ostf live migration test will try to list hypervisors though
novaclient.Compare those hypervisor names with current host name. But my
node's hostname is not consistent with hypervisor name. One is node-#
and the other is node-#.domain.tld. Of course it will easy to find
available host and return its hypervisor name. Then ostf will try to
live migration instance to a host which was specified by hypervisor
name. Nova can't find exist host then raise compute service of
node-#.domain.tld is unavailable.

We should use service's hostname instead of hpyervisor hostname to
compare with current hostname.

Change-Id: I0849054ae0f3be85d49b6fa2c95952d434fccc5a
Closes-Bug: 1521906

Change-Id: I8902bc61d830cc0c7f0e5dbae5aaf5b752cc80ce

commit_message:
Add script to prune data older than a retention period

Change-Id: I8902bc61d830cc0c7f0e5dbae5aaf5b752cc80ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-monasca refs/changes/08/263908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python # # TODO: Once monasca supports per-project retention policy, # use the monasca client to retrieve the policy and # honor that. For now, -l and -i can be used to accomplish # the same thing. # from datetime import datetime from prettytable import PrettyTable import keystoneclient.v2_0.client as keystone_client import argparse import json import sys import subprocess import time import os VSQL = "/usr/sbin/vsql" MON_TABLES = ["Definitions", "Dimensions", "DefinitionDimensions", "Measurements"] def main(): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser() group = parser.add_mutually_exclusive_group() help_text = """ Limit pruning to just this list of tenant name(s). """ group.add_argument('-l', '--limit', required=False, nargs='+', help=help_text) help_text = """ Ignore pruning for this list of tenant name(s). """ group.add_argument('-i', '--ignore', required=False, nargs='+', help=help_text) help_text = """ The name of the admin tenant. This tenant will not be pruned, and libvirt metrics that are cross-posted here will be pruned. """ parser.add_argument('-a', '--admin_tenant', required=True, help=help_text) help_text = """ Number of days of measurements to retain. """ parser.add_argument('-r', '--retain_days', required=True, help=help_text) args = parser.parse_args() before_counts = get_table_counts(MON_TABLES) prune_tables(args) display_pruning_result(before_counts) def prune_tables(args): now = time.time() start_time = get_isotime(now) retain_time = get_isotime(now - (int(args.retain_days) * 60 * 60 * 24)) tenants = get_tenant_list() admin_id = get_tenant_id(tenants, args.admin_tenant) print "Database pruning executing at %s" % start_time print "Keeping records later than %s" % retain_time print "Admin project '%s' (%s)" % (args.admin_tenant, admin_id) and_clause = "AND def.tenant_id != '%s'" % admin_id or_clause = "OR (def.tenant_id = '%s' AND def.name like 'vm.%%')" % \ admin_id if args.limit: limited_in_list = get_tenant_id_in_list(tenants, args.limit) and_clause = "AND def.tenant_id IN (%s)" % limited_in_list or_clause = "" if args.ignore: ignore_in_list = get_tenant_id_in_list(tenants, args.ignore) and_clause = \ "AND (def.tenant_id != '%s' AND def.tenant_id NOT IN (%s))" \ % (admin_id, ignore_in_list) delete_measurements_sql = """ DELETE FROM MonMetrics.Measurements WHERE time_stamp < '%s' AND definition_dimensions_id IN (SELECT defdims.id FROM MonMetrics.Definitions def, MonMetrics.DefinitionDimensions defdims LEFT OUTER JOIN MonMetrics.Dimensions dims ON dims.dimension_set_id = defdims.dimension_set_id WHERE def.id = defdims.definition_id %s %s); COMMIT; """ % (retain_time, and_clause, or_clause) delete_defdims_sql = """ DELETE FROM MonMetrics.DefinitionDimensions WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT definition_dimensions_id FROM MonMetrics.measurements); COMMIT; """ delete_dims_sql = """ DELETE FROM monmetrics.dimensions WHERE dimension_set_id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT dimension_set_id FROM monmetrics.definitiondimensions); COMMIT; """ delete_defs_sql = """ DELETE FROM monmetrics.definitions WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT definition_id FROM monmetrics.definitiondimensions); COMMIT; """ vsql(delete_measurements_sql) vsql(delete_defdims_sql) vsql(delete_dims_sql) vsql(delete_defs_sql) vsql("select make_ahm_now();") vsql("select purge();") def get_tenant_list(): kc = get_keystone_client() return kc.tenants.list() def get_tenant_id_in_list(tenants, names): tenant_ids = [] for tenant_name in names: tenant_id = get_tenant_id(tenants, tenant_name) tenant_ids.append(tenant_id) in_list = str(tenant_ids).strip('[]') return in_list def get_tenant_id(tenants, tenant_name): tenant_id = None for tenant in tenants: if tenant.name == tenant_name: tenant_id = tenant.id break if not tenant_id: print "Unable to find '%s' project -- aborting!" % tenant_name sys.exit(1) return str(tenant_id) def get_keystone_client(): kwargs = { 'username': os.environ['OS_USERNAME'], 'tenant_name': os.environ['OS_TENANT_NAME'], 'password': os.environ['OS_PASSWORD'], 'auth_url': os.environ['OS_AUTH_URL'], 'region_name': os.environ['OS_REGION_NAME'], } return keystone_client.Client(**kwargs) def get_table_counts(tables): counts = {} for table in tables: sql = "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM MonMetrics.%s" % table counts[table] = vsql(sql) return counts def display_pruning_result(before): display_table = PrettyTable(["Monasca Table", "Count Before", "Count After", "Rows Pruned"]) after = get_table_counts(MON_TABLES) for table in MON_TABLES: display_table.add_row([table, before[table], after[table], int(before[table]) - int(after[table])]) print display_table def vsql(sql): p = subprocess.Popen([VSQL, "-c", sql], stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE) out, err = p.communicate() if p.returncode != 0: print("vsql failed: %s %s" % (out, err)) return "" result_next_line = False for l in out.splitlines(): if '--' in l: # we want the next row result_next_line = True continue if result_next_line: return l def get_isotime(time_stamp): utc = str(datetime.utcfromtimestamp(time_stamp)) utc = utc.replace(" ", "T")[:-7] + 'Z' return utc if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Allow replacing a keyword argument

Specifying replace=True to renames.renamed_kwarg will substitute the
kwarg from the old to the new. This will allow for an argument to be
renamed and the positional argument still maintained in the case of a
direct rename.

Change-Id: Ibff3cc2bc3f35142f6415372f795890148898fa2

Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)

The usage of assertEqual(True/False, ***) should be changed
to a meaningful format of assertTrue/False(***).

subject: Add string format rendering to RoleCheck.__call__()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-17 05:56:36.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/_checks.py', 'oslo_policy/tests/test_checks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/efea2ada1cfdcfc6b58b09e4b812be90aadfc5cd', 'message': 'Add string format rendering to RoleCheck.__call__()

RoleCheck.__call__() doesn't render string format with target dict.
So, it couldn't handle rules like below:

"identity:create_grant": "role: %{target.role.name}s"

This patch adds string format rendering code to it. If target_dict
has a key specified at %()s in the rule, __call__() will render its
value and evaluate the rule. If not, the method will return False.

Change-Id: I82d677301ca2c764230ed9b3e3e9d82056afcea2
Closes-Bug: #1527055
'}]
commit_message:
Add string format rendering to RoleCheck.__call__()

RoleCheck.__call__() doesn't render string format with target dict.
So, it couldn't handle rules like below:

"identity:create_grant": "role: %{target.role.name}s"

This patch adds string format rendering code to it. If target_dict
has a key specified at %()s in the rule, __call__() will render its
value and evaluate the rule. If not, the method will return False.

Change-Id: I82d677301ca2c764230ed9b3e3e9d82056afcea2
Closes-Bug: #1527055
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/08/258808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertTrue(check({}, dict(roles=['SpAm']), self.enforcer)) self.assertFalse(check({}, dict(roles=[]), self.enforcer)) def test_format_value(self): check = _checks.RoleCheck('role', '%(target.role.name)s') target_dict = {'target.role.name': 'a'} cred_dict = dict(user='user', roles=['a', 'b', 'c']) self.assertTrue(check(target_dict, cred_dict, self.enforcer)) target_dict = {'target.role.name': 'd'} self.assertFalse(check(target_dict, cred_dict, self.enforcer)) target_dict = dict(target=dict(role=dict())) self.assertFalse(check(target_dict, cred_dict, self.enforcer))
deleted_lines: self.assertTrue(check('target', dict(roles=['SpAm']), self.enforcer)) self.assertFalse(check('target', dict(roles=[]), self.enforcer))

added_lines: BASE_DIR = os.path.abspath(os.path.join( os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__)), '../..')) self.images_dir = self._get_images_dir() def _get_images_dir(self): possible_base_paths = ( os.path.join(sys.prefix, 'share/kolla'), os.path.join(sys.prefix, 'local/share/kolla'), BASE_DIR) for base_path in possible_base_paths: image_path = os.path.join(base_path, 'docker') if os.path.exists(image_path): LOG.info('Found the docker image folder at %s', image_path) return image_path else: raise KollaDirNotFoundException('Image dir can not be found')
deleted_lines: import platformdef find_os_type(): return platform.linux_distribution() def find_base_dir(): script_path = os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(sys.argv[0])) if os.path.basename(script_path) == 'cmd': return os.path.realpath(os.path.join(script_path, '..', '..')) if os.path.basename(script_path) == 'bin': if find_os_type()[0] in ['Ubuntu', 'debian']: return '/usr/local/share/kolla' else: return '/usr/share/kolla' if os.path.exists(os.path.join(script_path, 'tests')): return script_path raise KollaDirNotFoundException( 'I do not know where your Kolla directory is' ) self.base_dir = os.path.abspath(find_base_dir()) LOG.debug("Kolla base directory: " + self.base_dir) self.images_dir = os.path.join(self.base_dir, 'docker')

commit_message:
[zmq] Switch notifications to PUB/SUB pattern

In this change PUB/SUB pattern was used for notifications.
Reduced useless split to direct/fanout notifications.
All notifications are fanout by default.

Change-Id: I232c093af76757dc6fc5e942d47f0473877f9efa
Closes-Bug: #1529845

commit_message:
Refactoring of tests/eventlet_service.py

The run() method was using much more code than required. Simplify this.
Add a workers argument to run() method.
Make port_queue argument mandatory as without this we fall over.

Change-Id: I3618dec41009606269d267969bff36906d79e620
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.service refs/changes/84/260384/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated. It still used in a few places.
Updated to non-deprecated LOG.warning.

Closes-Bug:#1508442

commit_message:
Add basic get_live_state implementation

NOTE: get_reality renamed to get_live_state

Add get_live_state method implementation for Resource and
change update method with reality using logic.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: Iadc6487341b7a6285bbfd6676f13f7a5ae2c9dab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/65/244065/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def frozen_definition(self, reality=False): if reality: args = {'properties': self._get_reality()} elif self._stored_properties_data is not None: def update(self, after, before=None, prev_resource=None, reality=False): before = self.frozen_definition(reality=reality) def _get_reality(self): """Default implementation; should be overridden by resources. :returns: dict of resource's real state of properties. """ pass
deleted_lines: def frozen_definition(self): if self._stored_properties_data is not None: def update(self, after, before=None, prev_resource=None): before = self.frozen_definition()

commit_message:
Allow the creation of VLAN-tagged bonds in network templates

This allows a bond to be defined in a common template and
VLAN-tagged subinterfaces to be defined in role-specific templates.

Change-Id: I5a405bb835e40d48b6cd51d7ff55beb2db78319e
Closes-bug: #1527259
(cherry picked from commit ce0d53f9982575ca720428016130adaa5ef485b2)

commit_message:
Remove unintended master-orientated ansible-role-requirements

This patch removes roles meant for a the master branch only from the
ansible-role-requirements file.

It also adds two search paths for roles in tests/ansible.cfg to ensure that
the bootstrap execution has access to both the pip_install and sshd roles.

Change-Id: Iebde74eace774831372d889a8a1c54389eccbd1d

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I817777147f95ea01d6eb86cc619e59ee554ebb5d
Closes-Bug: #1530742

commit_message:
Remove dependency on oslo_log

So far, only the impl_rabbit driver has required oslo_log. This patch
replaces the usage of `LOG.trace` with `LOG.error` in the driver so that
we'll be able to lift this dependency.

As a library, oslo.messaging doesn't really need to depend on oslo_log,
in fact it has barely depended on it.

commit_message:
Fix Monasca Tempest tests to use correct cred

Tempest provides three different credential providers for tests:
- dynamic credentials, which is what is used in all gate jobs
- preprovisioned credentials, which is used in experimental and
  periodic jobs, not yet in the gate because of bug 1524717
- legacy credentials, which relies on deprecated configuration
  options, and which is itself deprecated.

More details-
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/configuration.html#credential-provider-mechanisms

Monasca used legacy credentials which is now failing on gate
job as devstack does not set those cred options in conf.
 - I65b56ff681d6c27094380693c953fbc3664eceb0

This commit fix gate failure to use dynamic cred.

Comment out tests that are now failing.
Tests are failing because they are now being run in parallel.
The change to dynamic credentials caused the tests to be run in parallel.

Change-Id: I935154f152a834929a18b5a4db8407d717939dea

commit_message:
Delete OVS port on unstack to retain system connectivity

If you configure devstack with the following three values,
for example:

PHYSICAL_NETWORK=eth0
PUBLIC_INTERFACE=eth0
OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE=br-eth0

This will cause devstack to create an OVS bridge, create a port for
eth0, and add it to the bridge (along with it's IP address).

The problem is that on unstack the port is never deleted from OVS,
so eth0 gets "trapped", not showing up in any of the OVS commands,
but not usable by the system.  The only workaround is to unload the
OVS kernel module.

There needs to be an 'ovs-vsctl del-port ...' call at the end of
_move_neutron_addresses_route() on unstack - the antidote to the
'ovs-vsctl add-port ...', that happened on stack.

Closes-Bug: #1516801

Change-Id: Id2ff60f1f8e8fffff1eaffd68d9de4f6aa772943
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/25/246725/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local del_ovs_port=$4 local af=$5 local DEL_OVS_PORT="" if [[ "$del_ovs_port" == "True" ]]; then DEL_OVS_PORT="sudo ovs-vsctl --if-exists del-port $from_intf $to_intf" fi # The add/del OVS port calls have to happen either before or # after the address is moved in order to not leave it orphaned. $DEL_OVS_PORT; $IP_DEL; $IP_ADD; $ADD_OVS_PORT; $ADD_DEFAULT_ROUTE _move_neutron_addresses_route "$OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" "$PUBLIC_INTERFACE" False True "inet" _move_neutron_addresses_route "$OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" "$PUBLIC_INTERFACE" False False "inet6" _move_neutron_addresses_route "$PUBLIC_INTERFACE" "$OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" True False "inet" _move_neutron_addresses_route "$PUBLIC_INTERFACE" "$OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" False False "inet6"
deleted_lines: local af=$4 $IP_DEL; $IP_ADD; $ADD_OVS_PORT; $ADD_DEFAULT_ROUTE _move_neutron_addresses_route "$OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" "$PUBLIC_INTERFACE" False "inet" _move_neutron_addresses_route "$OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" "$PUBLIC_INTERFACE" False "inet6" _move_neutron_addresses_route "$PUBLIC_INTERFACE" "$OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" True "inet" _move_neutron_addresses_route "$PUBLIC_INTERFACE" "$OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" False "inet6"

commit_message:
[Scenario] Add dummy scenario for new output format

This patch adds new scenario `Dummy.dummy_output'
that generates random output, both additive and complete.

Change-Id: I1ab2a70fa325983080367ed14579d7b91ccda5d2
Implements: spec improve_scenario_output_format.rst

commit_message:
Enable SameHostFilter and DifferentHostFilter

The default filters of nova don't contain SameHostFilter and
DifferentHostFilter, so we cannot test them on the gate.
This patch makes these filters available for the development.

Change-Id: Ia6b4847e9bb21048d254d0a460ae4c5be896b17b
Closes-Bug: #1526620
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/82/258882/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FILTERS=${FILTERS:-RetryFilter,AvailabilityZoneFilter,RamFilter,DiskFilter,ComputeFilter,ComputeCapabilitiesFilter,ImagePropertiesFilter,ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter,ServerGroupAffinityFilter,SameHostFilter,DifferentHostFilter} iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT scheduler_default_filters "$FILTERS"

commit_message:
Add a mechanism to mask passwords in dictionaries

The widely used mask_password() function will mask passwords in
strings using a list of keys and patterns. This change extends it to
work on dictionaries as well. This allows one to directly invoke
mask_dict_passwords() on a dictionary and this will have the
effect of masking not only the strings (values) but also mask the
values if the keys in the dictionary are part of the list of
sanitization keys.

If the dictionary contains nested dictionaries, those will be
recursively masked as well.

Change-Id: I7ebafdeb671da36e0fdc9d6983a17ac5481b6f28
Closes-Bug: 1526041
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils refs/changes/61/257561/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def mask_dictionary_password(dictionary, secret="***"): # nosec """Replace password with *secret* in a dictionary. :param dictionary: The dictionary which includes security information. :param secret: value with which to replace passwords. :returns: The dictionary with string substitutions. For example: >>> mask_dict_password({'password': 'd81juxmEW_', >>> 'user': 'admin', >>> 'home-dir': '/home/admin'}, >>> '???') {'password': '???', 'user': 'admin', 'home-dir': '/home/admin'} .. versionadded:: 3.2.1 """ out = {} for k, v in dictionary.iteritems(): for key in _SANITIZE_KEYS: if key == k: v = secret else: v = mask_password(v, secret) out[k] = v return out

commit_message:
Adds IPv6 support for interface_for_ip function

Proper interface matching when an IPv6 address is provided.

If Facter version used is < 3 then it adds the netmask6 facts as custom facts.

Fix bugs https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1280523

Change-Id: Ide26ca1740dc12ea5f47a28f4cecacd6ef0b18f9
(cherry picked from commit 11a0619a290d64f3caa45435a23f3e503530087a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/85/260885/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ip1 = IPAddr.new(arg[0]) next if interface == '.' || interface == '..' if ip1.ipv4? ipaddress_name = "ipaddress_#{iface_no_dash}" netmask_name = "netmask_#{iface_no_dash}" else ipaddress_name = "ipaddress6_#{iface_no_dash}" netmask_name = "netmask6_#{iface_no_dash}" end interface_ip = lookupvar(ipaddress_name) netmask = lookupvar(netmask_name) unless interface_ip.nil? then ip2 = IPAddr.new(interface_ip) return interface if ip1.mask(netmask) == ip2.mask(netmask) rescue IPAddr::InvalidAddressError => e raise Puppet::ParseError, "#{e}: #{arg[0]}" raise Puppet::ParseError, "Syntax error: #{arg[0]} must be a String"
deleted_lines: ip_to_find = arg[0] next if interface == '.' or interface == '..' interface_ip = lookupvar("ipaddress_#{iface_no_dash}") netmask = lookupvar("netmask_#{iface_no_dash}") if not interface_ip.nil? then ip1=IPAddr.new(interface_ip) ip2=IPAddr.new(ip_to_find) if ip1.mask(netmask) == ip2.mask(netmask) then return interface end rescue JSON::ParserError raise Puppet::ParseError, "Syntax error: #{arg[0]} is invalid" raise Puppet::ParseError, "Syntax error: #{arg[0]} is not a String"

commit_message:
Automate failover acceptance tests

Partial-bug: #1524772
Change-Id: I91abf769e8a92114185bf6cdc8896d1e72433ef7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/81/263781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from devops.helpers.helpers import wait from proboscis import test from proboscis.asserts import assert_true, assert_equal from fuelweb_test import logger from fuelweb_test import settings from fuelweb_test.helpers.decorators import log_snapshot_after_test from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import TestBasic @test(groups=['failover_group_1']) class FailoverGroup1(TestBasic): """FailoverGroup1""" # TODO documentation @test(depends_on_groups=['prepare_slaves_5'], groups=['deploy_ha_cinder']) @log_snapshot_after_test def deploy_ha_cinder(self): """Deploy environment with 3 controllers, Cinder and NeutronVLAN Scenario: 1. Create environment with Cinder for storage and Neutron VLAN 2. Add 3 controller, 2 compute+cinder nodes 3. Verify networks 4. Deploy environment 5. Verify networks 6. Run OSTF tests Duration 120m Snapshot deploy_ha_cinder """ self.env.revert_snapshot('ready_with_5_slaves') self.show_step(1) data = { 'tenant': 'failover', 'user': 'failover', 'password': 'failover', "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['vlan'], } cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, settings=data ) self.show_step(2) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['compute', 'cinder'], 'slave-05': ['compute', 'cinder'], } ) self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(6) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot('deploy_ha_cinder', is_make=True) @test(depends_on_groups=['deploy_ha_cinder'], groups=['lock_db_access_from_primary_controller']) @log_snapshot_after_test def lock_db_access_from_primary_controller(self): """Lock DB access from primary controller for Neutron Scenario: 1. Revert environment with 3 controller nodes 2. Lock DB access from primary controller (emulate non-responsiveness of MySQL from the controller where management VIP located) 3. Verify networks 4. Run HA OSTF tests, check MySQL tests fail 5. Run Smoke and Sanity OSTF tests Duration 20m Snapshot lock_db_access_from_primary_controller """ self.show_step(1) self.env.revert_snapshot('deploy_ha_cinder') self.show_step(2) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() controllers = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles( cluster_id, roles=('controller',)) assert_equal(len(controllers), 3, 'Environment does not have 3 controller nodes, ' 'found {} nodes!'.format(len(controllers))) target_controllers = self.fuel_web.get_pacemaker_resource_location( controllers[0]['fqdn'], 'vip__management') assert_equal(len(target_controllers), 1, 'Expected 1 controller with "vip__management" resource ' 'running, found {0}: {1}!'.format(len(target_controllers), target_controllers)) target_controller = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_devops_node( target_controllers[0]) result = self.ssh_manager.execute( ip=target_controller['ip'], cmd='iptables -I OUTPUT -p tcp --dport 4567 -j DROP && ' 'iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 4567 -j DROP') assert_equal(result['exit_code'], 0, "Lock DB access failed: {0}!".format(result)) self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id, test_sets=['ha'], should_fail=4) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot('lock_db_access_from_primary_controller') @test(depends_on_groups=['deploy_ha_cinder'], groups=['recovery_neutron_agents_after_restart']) @log_snapshot_after_test def recovery_neutron_agents_after_restart(self): """Recovery of Neutron agents after restart Scenario: 1. Revert environment with 3 controller nodes 2. Kill Neutron agents at all on one of the controllers. Pacemaker should restart it 3. Verify networks 4. Run OSTF tests Duration 20m Snapshot recovery_neutron_agents_after_restart """ self.show_step(1) #self.env.revert_snapshot('deploy_ha_cinder') self.show_step(2) neutron_agents = [ {'name': 'neutron-openvswitch-agent', 'resource': 'p_neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent'}, {'name': 'neutron-l3-agent', 'resource': 'p_neutron-l3-agent'}, {'name': 'neutron-dhcp-agent', 'resource': 'p_neutron-dhcp-agent'}, {'name': 'neutron-metadata-agent', 'resource': 'p_neutron-metadata-agent'} ] cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() controllers = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles( cluster_id, roles=('controller',)) assert_equal(len(controllers), 3, 'Environment does not have 3 controller nodes, ' 'found {} nodes!'.format(len(controllers))) for agent in neutron_agents: target_controllers = self.fuel_web.get_pacemaker_resource_location( controllers[0]['fqdn'], agent['resource']) assert_true(len(target_controllers) >= 1, "Didn't find controllers with " "running {0} on it".format(agent['name'])) target_controller = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_devops_node( target_controllers[0]) old_pids = self.ssh_manager.execute( target_controller['ip'], cmd='pgrep -f {}'.format(agent['name']))['stdout'] assert_true(len(old_pids) > 0, 'PIDs of {0} not found on {1}'.format( agent['name'], target_controller['name'])) logger.debug('Old PIDs of {0} on {1}: {2}'.format( agent['name'], target_controller['name'], old_pids)) result = self.ssh_manager.execute( target_controller['ip'], cmd='pkill -9 -f {}'.format(agent['name'])) assert_equal(result['exit_code'], 0, 'Processes of {0} were not killed on {1}: {2}'.format( agent['name'], target_controller['name'], result)) wait(lambda: len(self.ssh_manager.execute( target_controller['ip'], cmd='pgrep -f {}'.format(agent['name']))['stdout']) > 0, timeout=60, timeout_msg='Neutron agent {0} was not recovered on node {1} ' 'within 60 seconds!'.format( agent['name'], target_controller['name'])) new_pids = self.ssh_manager.execute( target_controller['ip'], cmd='pgrep -f {}'.format(agent['name']))['stdout'] bad_pids = set(old_pids) & set(new_pids) assert_equal(len(bad_pids), 0, '{0} processes with PIDs {1} were not ' 'killed on {2}!'.format(agent['name'], bad_pids, target_controller['name'])) self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id, test_sets=['ha', 'smoke', 'sanity']) self.env.make_snapshot('recovery_neutron_agents_after_restart')

commit_message:
tests: do not hardcode /tmp

It's better to use $TMPDIR if available.

Change-Id: I33599e7acf8e0cf833b3b01e8a202013a3add753

commit_message:
Add automated acceptance tests for NeutronTUN

- 3 controllers + operation system roles.
- External DNS, NTP, Ceph for images and RadosGW for objects.
- No storage for volumes, Ceph for Images and ephemeral, changed partitioning for ceph vdc, changed public network mask.
- Ceph for all and separated operation system role
- Ceph for all, untag networks and changed openstack credentials
- 5 controllers, Ceph for ephemeral volumes, changed vdc partition on Ceph nodes and changed public CIDR from /24 to /25

Change-Id: I47b4fed649353d87954d59b5193b525590f7f320
Related-Bug: #1524772

commit_message:
Added pre-post tasks validation to plugins builder

- The plugin deployment tasks now could contain
  cross-depends and cross-depended-by properties
  inroduced by task based deploment feature.

Change-Id: Icb351e4475ba6e78e7c8ef22cefc255116d44ba8
Related-Bug: #1527325
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-plugins refs/changes/18/259818/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import loggingfrom fuel_plugin_builder import utilslogger = logging.getLogger(__name__) def check_deployment_tasks(self): logger.debug( 'Start deployment tasks checking "%s"', self.deployment_tasks_path) deployment_tasks = utils.parse_yaml(self.deployment_tasks_path) schemas = { 'puppet': self.schema.puppet_task, 'shell': self.schema.shell_task, 'group': self.schema.group_task, 'skipped': self.schema.skipped_task, 'copy_files': self.schema.copy_files_task, 'sync': self.schema.sync_task, 'upload_file': self.schema.upload_file_task, 'stage': self.schema.stage_task, 'reboot': self.schema.reboot_task} for idx, deployment_task in enumerate(deployment_tasks): self.validate_schema( deployment_task, schemas[deployment_task['type']], self.deployment_tasks_path, value_path=[idx])

commit_message:
Adds FC Utils

This patch adds a FC Utils module, used for retrieving information
about FC HBAs and discovering FC luns.

Co-Authored-By: Alin Balutoiu <abalutoiu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially-implements: blueprint hyperv-fibre-channel
Change-Id: If66815867f1ef50628c59bac02796e2c8e866e9c

Numerous corrections to the docstrings

* Added missing versionchanged for deprecated_reason on Opt
* Added missing docstring param for deprecated_names
* Added missing docstring param for current_name
* Reordered some docstring params to follow parameter order

Change-Id: Ic9c7bc9825c29758dde84d81028b0835be93c5a7

commit_message:
Implements estimate_instance_overhead()

estimate_instance_overhead is an compute interfaces which returns
the instance virtualization overhead required to build an instance.

Change-Id: I7aa598cc44cd26159221462fe63f46e273c67cfe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/15/254715/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from pypowervm.tasks import memory as pvm_memdef estimate_instance_overhead(adapter, flavor, host_uuid): """Calculates the memory overhead required to build the instance. :param adapter: The adapter for the pypowervm API. :param instance_info: The flavor object. :param host_uuid: The host UUID :returns: Overhead memory in mb. """ mem_data = {'max_mem': flavor.memory_mb} mem_overhead, avail_mem = pvm_mem.calculate_memory_overhead_on_host( adapter, host_uuid, mem_data) return mem_overhead

commit_message:
Add debug flag in the config

1) Let server read the debug flag from config
2) Write the test case, use assertEqual for explicity
3) Keep the value to True for current usage

Change-Id: I83e4ae92e43b8be92cf92ff257f317ed1bf9491e
Closes-Bug: #1531073

commit_message:
Revert the change 237710

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/237710 is intended only for
debugging use and this commit is staged for merging just before the
mitaka release. It will ensure that the debugging code cannot be
accidentally turned on in a production mitaka system. However, the
code is all there and a discerning user could, if desired enable it.

It has been made intentioanlly harder than just switching on a
configuration parameter.

Change-Id: Ib48d153d3be16e0424c2b2f9477d8c3107492b1e

commit_message:
change topology api to get complex query

Implements: blueprint get-topology-api
Change-Id: I706684992b8f9e7c1bda4a9f386c78ab9c4adb54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-vitrageclient refs/changes/52/264152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json def get(self, depth=None, graph_type='graph', query=None, root=None, limit=None): :param limit: the depth of the topology graph :param root: the root of the topology graph :param query: the query filter for the topology params = dict(depth=depth, graph_type=graph_type, query=json.loads(query), root=root) return self.api.post(self.URL, json=params).json()
deleted_lines: def get(self, edges=None, vertices=None, depth=None, graph_type='graph'): :param vertices: list of vertices types :param edges: list of edges type params = dict(edges=edges, vertices=vertices, depth=depth, graph_type=graph_type) return self.api.get(self.URL, params=params).json()

subject: Ensure cluster remains stable during services restarts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-18 16:24:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/9c6a417f342fd6dea269fb0120718197295bf8cd', 'message': "Ensure all pcmk services are in started state in PostPuppet

This change adds a check at the end of the restart sequence to
make sure all the services are up; 'pcs resource enable' does
not give a guarantee about dependant services have all started.

Also raises the httpd stop timeout to 200secs because 100secs
collides with the stop timeout we set for the pcmk managed systemd
resources.

Change-Id: I80199653024383fd07900dad0b8d23fb8afade26
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-18 16:37:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/ff32197367d524e724df7efddc4c085fc786ada4', 'message': "Ensure all pcmk services are in started state in PostPuppet

This change adds a check at the end of the restart sequence to
make sure all the services are up; 'pcs resource enable' does
not give a guarantee about dependant services have all started.

Also raises the httpd stop timeout to 200secs because 100secs
collides with the stop timeout we set for the pcmk managed systemd
resources.

Change-Id: I80199653024383fd07900dad0b8d23fb8afade26
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure cluster remains stable during services restarts

Using crm_resource --wait we wait for the cluster to get into
a stable state before moving into the next step of the piloted
restart procedure.

Change-Id: I80199653024383fd07900dad0b8d23fb8afade26
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add backref relationships to ConsistencyGroup obj

ConsistencyGroup object was missing relationships that were defined on
the SQLAlchemy model as backrefs. This includes volumes and cgsnapshots
fields. This commit adds fields representing these relationships.

Change-Id: Ia74997ddfed1e472874b6892c2fcaa208b7a9a3c
Partial-Bug: 1509012

commit_message:
Add automated acceptance tests for NeutronTUN

- 3 controllers + operation system roles.
- External DNS, NTP, Ceph for images and RadosGW for objects.
- No storage for volumes, Ceph for Images and ephemeral, changed partitioning for ceph vdc, changed public network mask.
- Ceph for all and separated operation system role
- Ceph for all, untag networks and changed openstack credentials
- 5 controllers, Ceph for ephemeral volumes, changed vdc partition on Ceph nodes and changed public CIDR from /24 to /25

Change-Id: I47b4fed649353d87954d59b5193b525590f7f320
Related-Bug: #1524772

commit_message:
Maintain PathUtils interface

SMB related utils have been refactored into smbutils from
pathutils. PathUtils should still maintain the same interface
until the SMB method calls are done properly through SMBUtils.

Change-Id: Ifc18bc14c2a87f8a0eb44064d4074bdc3cd23abe

commit_message:
Use the grub2 element instead of grub2-deprecated

Let's stop using the grub2-deprecated in favor of the grub2 element. The
grub2 element has been merged for a while and it also installs the EFI
modules which are required for booting with UEFI.

Change-Id: I8ba1a38a17f2866ad124d06c264faeaa10856c51

branch for OVS installations

commit_message:
Use include for swift::storage::${type}

Require operator specify swiftinit provider
on supported components rather then pass it through.

Change-Id: I7e35c0a49f51e252573f46af9ba2a8eda968e3e2
Closes-Bug: #1524381
(cherry picked from commit 67df8085d0422d5eec43e52c0cd738c43e9b2d3f)

added_lines: ``` class { '::swift::storage::account': service_provider => 'swiftinit', } class { '::swift::storage::container': service_provider => 'swiftinit', } class { '::swift::storage::object': service_provider => 'swiftinit', } class {'::swift::objectexpirer': service_provider => 'swiftinit', } class { '::swift::proxy': service_provider => 'swiftinit', } ```
deleted_lines: Setting: `service_provider => 'swiftinit'` Is supported on the following components: * swift::storage:all * swift::storage:node * swift::storage:server * swift::storage::(account|container|object) * swift::proxy
